question: Who among the following is famous for saving the empire from the Huna tribe, which had overran Asia and Europe.
explanation: Skandagupta was a Gupta Emperor of northern India. His Bhitari pillar inscription suggests that he restored the Gupta power by defeating his enemies, who may have been rebels or foreign invaders.He saved empire from Huna tribe. He also repulsed an invasion by the Indo-Hephthalites, probably the Kidarites.
